title: DPRK refuses to parade with South Korea
description: The Democratic People’s Republic of Korea (DPRK) Sports Delegation expressed their refusal to parade together with South Korea delegation at the opening ceremony of the London Olympics, said Kim Pyong Sik, the head of DPRK’s Sports Delegation and the vice minister of sports on July 14.South Korea’s confrontational policy obstructs the sports exchange with the DPRK, he said.
cleanContent: By Yu Runze, Sina EnglishThe Democratic People’s Republic of Korea (DPRK) Sports Delegation expressed their refusal to parade together with South Korea delegation at the opening ceremony of the London Olympics, said Kim Pyong Sik, the head of DPRK’s Sports Delegation and the vice minister of sports on July 14.South Korea’s confrontational policy obstructs the sports exchange with the DPRK, he said.“Under this situation, how can we walk together at the Olympic the opening ceremony”, said Kim Pyong Sik.In 2000, North and South Korean athletes were seen walking together at the opening ceremony of the Sydney Olympics, for the first time under the banner of “Unification”.																																																																								|  |
